name: Water Resources on Indian Lands
objective: To support Indian tribes in the effective and efficient management, planning, and use of their water resources.
applicant_types: Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)

results.description: Indian Affairs fulfilled program objectives by issuing approximately 100 Self Determination and Cooperative Agreement awards in FY2020.
Indian Affairs issued 98 new awards and modifications to existing awards to 68 recipients.
Awards 45 grants to entities to complete the goals and objectives of the program.
This award funded 184 programs to support Indian tribes in the effective and efficient management, planning, and use of their water resources.

authorizations.text: Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act, Public Law 93-638, as amended, 25 U.S.C. 450; Snyder Act of 1921, 25 U.S.C. 13, Public Law 67-85, 42 Stat. 208.

rules_regulations: Notice of Revised Instructions for Preparing and Prioritizing Water Program Funding Requests, Federal Register, Vol. 70, No. 201, Wednesday, October 19, 2005.
